summary:
The Security Council:
- Will closely monitor compliance with measures to ensure effective monitoring and implementation, including a possible monitoring mechanism (para 23).
- Urges neighboring states, particularly Rwanda and Uganda, to positively influence armed groups to settle disputes peacefully and join national reconciliation (para 24).
- Authorizes MONUC to protect UN personnel, facilities, and civilians under threat, and to contribute to improved security conditions for humanitarian assistance (para 25).
- Authorizes MONUC to use necessary means to fulfill its mandate in Ituri, North, and South Kivu (para 26).
- Requests the Secretary-General to deploy a tactical brigade-size force to Ituri to stabilize security and improve humanitarian situation (para 27).
- Condemns the illegal exploitation of natural resources, intends to consider means to end it, and demands cooperation with the group of experts (para 28).
- Encourages Governments of the region to normalize relations, cooperate on mutual security, and conclude good-neighborly agreements (para 29).
- Reaffirms the need for an international conference on peace, security, democracy, and development in the Great Lakes region (para 30).
- Reiterates support for the Special Representative of the Secretary-General, MONUC personnel, and their efforts to advance the peace process (para 31).
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 32).
